headline: AI trade is helping build out the 'next new economy': Strategist
summary: As the AI boom continues, investors hedge their bets on what's next for the AI trade as companies spend trillions building out AI infrastructure. Pence Capital Management CIO Dryden Pence sits down with Market Domination Host Josh Lipton to talk about his expectations for the AI space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: AI trade is helping build out the 'next new economy': Strategist
content.description:
As the AI boom continues, investors hedge their bets on what's next for the AI trade as companies spend trillions building out AI infrastructure. Pence Capital Management CIO Dryden Pence sits down with Market Domination Host Josh Lipton to talk about his expectations for the AI space.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Michael Burry Asks For Photos Of Warehoused Nvidia GPUs After Analyst Questions Jensen Huang's Blackwell Shipment Numbers (UPDATED)
summary: Editor’s Note: This story has been updated to provide additional clarity on Nvidia GPU dies shipped in 2025. Over the weekend, Michael Burry, the investor made famous by "The Big Short" for forecasting the 2008 housing collapse, asked for evidence of stockpiled Nvidia Corp (NASDAQ:NVDA) GPUs. This development came after an analysis on X questioned whether Jensen Huang's statement about Blackwell shipments aligns with the company's reported revenue and U.S. data-center capacity. Burry Joins Debat

headline: Micron Earnings ‘Best’ in Chip History After Nvidia. How Its Stock Became the New AI Darling.
summary: Micron  Technology earnings are out—and the AI trade may be back on track.  Micron Technology stock surged Thursday, the day after the memory chip maker reported better-than-expected earnings results and gave guidance that was significantly higher than expectations.  For the current quarter, Micron forecast a revenue range with a midpoint of $18.7 billion, above analysts’ expectations of $14.3 billion.

content.title: Micron Earnings ‘Best’ in Chip History After Nvidia. How Its Stock Became the New AI Darling.
content.summary: Micron  Technology earnings are out—and the AI trade may be back on track.  Micron Technology stock surged Thursday, the day after the memory chip maker reported better-than-expected earnings results and gave guidance that was significantly higher than expectations.  For the current quarter, Micron forecast a revenue range with a midpoint of $18.7 billion, above analysts’ expectations of $14.3 billion.

headline: As Nvidia Launches New Nemotron 3 Models, Should You Buy, Sell, or Hold NVDA Stock?
summary: Nvidia remains a high‑growth AI infrastructure leader, but after a $4 trillion valuation and recent volatility, the setup looks best as a hold with a buy‑the‑dip bias rather than an all‑in bet.

headline: U.S. Tech Stocks Rebound Premarket After Heavy Selloff
summary: Shares in U.S. tech stocks recovered slightly premarket after a heavy selloff in the prior session. Oracle climbed 1% premarket, having dropped 5.4% to a six-month low Wednesday. Broadcom stock is also on the rise after shedding roughly $422 billion of its market cap over the last five trading days.

content.title: U.S. Tech Stocks Rebound Premarket After Heavy Selloff
content.summary: Shares in U.S. tech stocks recovered slightly premarket after a heavy selloff in the prior session. Oracle climbed 1% premarket, having dropped 5.4% to a six-month low Wednesday. Broadcom stock is also on the rise after shedding roughly $422 billion of its market cap over the last five trading days.

headline: Stocks Climb Before the Open on Micron Boost Ahead of U.S. Inflation Data

headline: AMZN and AMD: Cowen Calls These 2 AI Stock Giants Its Best Ideas for 2026
summary: So much has happened this year. After a spring correction triggered by President Trump’s aggressive tariff policies, stocks staged a powerful rebound as inflation cooled and markets began pricing in a more accommodative Federal Reserve. At the same time, strong earnings and relentless enthusiasm around AI propelled mega-cap leadership, pushing the S&P 500 to nearly a 16% gain for the year. headline: JPMorgan Quants Warn of ‘Extreme Crowding’ in Speculative Stocks
summary: The list includes Broadcom Inc., Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Expedia Group Inc., Estee Lauder Cos Inc., Invesco Ltd. and Nucor Corp.  The selloff has been led by tech shares as investors rotate out of winners — an event the JPMorgan quants warned about.

content.title: JPMorgan Quants Warn of ‘Extreme Crowding’ in Speculative Stocks
content.summary: The list includes Broadcom Inc., Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Expedia Group Inc., Estee Lauder Cos Inc., Invesco Ltd. and Nucor Corp.  The selloff has been led by tech shares as investors rotate out of winners — an event the JPMorgan quants warned about.
